resources.string:
This password will be used both to unlock the application and to trigger data deletion. If you configure the app properly, entering this password on the lock screen will perform the destructive actions you specify. Here are some tips:

• Enter a strong password.

• The Android system places restrictions on lock-screen passwords. Typically a password must be between 4 and 16 characters long and must not contain non-ASCII letters. Some firmware enforces different rules, so these restrictions cannot always be applied programmatically — you need to test them on your device.

• Choose a password similar to your device password. If the passwords are similar, an adversary is more likely to believe you entered the wrong password by mistake.
Time to crack (via lock screen interface): %1$s
